required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomised, Open-label, Three-way Crossover Study to Assess the Pharmacokinetics and Safety of Single Doses of Four Sprays of Sativex® in a Range of Oral pH Environments in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Open-label, Three-way Crossover Study to Assess the Pharmacokinetics and Safety of Single Doses of Four Sprays of Sativex® in a Range of Oral pH Environments in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the effect of oral pH on the pharmacokinetics (PK) of a single oromucosal dose of Sativex (four sprays containing 10.8 mg Δ9 tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) and 10 mg cannabidiol (CBD)) by comparing the PK profile of Sativex in healthy subjects.
The primary clinical hypothesis is that there will be an effect of oral pH on the PK of Sativex when administered as a single oromucosal dose (four sprays).

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of THC: Cmax, AUC(0-t), and AUC(0-∞)
primary_outcome.description: Mean highest observed plasma concentration of the measured concentration-time profile (Cmax), area under the concentration-time curve from administration to the last sampling point (AUC(0-t)), and area under the concentration-time curve extrapolated to infinity (AUC(0-∞)) of THC are presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of CBD: Cmax, AUC(0-t), and AUC(0-∞)
primary_outcome.description: Mean Cmax, AUC(0-t), and AUC(0-∞) of CBD are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of 11-hydroxy-CBD (11-OH-CBD): Cmax, AUC(0-t), and AUC(0-∞)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Cmax, AUC(0-t), and AUC(0-∞) of 11-OH-CBD are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of 7-hydroxy-CBD (7-OH-CBD): Cmax, AUC(0-t), and AUC(0-∞)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Cmax, AUC(0-t), and AUC(0-∞) of 7-OH-CBD are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of 6-hydroxy-CBD (6-OH-CBD): Cmax, AUC(0-t), and AUC(0-∞)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Cmax, AUC(0-t), and AUC(0-∞) of 6-OH-CBD are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of THC: t½ and Tmax
secondary_outcome.description: Mean terminal elimination half-life (t½) and time to maximum plasma concentration (Tmax) of THC are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of 11-OH-CBD: t½ and Tmax
secondary_outcome.description: Mean t½ and Tmax of 11-OH-CBD are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of CBD: t½ and Tmax
secondary_outcome.description: Mean t½ and Tmax of CBD are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of 7-OH-CBD: t½ and Tmax
secondary_outcome.description: Mean t½ and Tmax of 7-OH-CBD are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of 6-OH-CBD: t½ and Tmax
secondary_outcome.description: Mean t½ and Tmax of 6-OH-CBD are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total body clearance (CL/F) of THC and CBD from plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Mean total body clearance of THC and CBD from plasma is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of adverse events as measure of subject safety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to follow-up, an expected average of 35 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects who experienced an adverse event during the study is presented. The time-frame for adverse event reporting was from screening to the follow-up visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of subjects with a clinically significant change in physical and oral examination results, relative to pre-treatment baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to follow-up, an expected average of 35 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with a change in physical and oral examination results indicative of an adverse event, relative to the pre-treatment baseline, is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of subjects with a clinically significant change in 12-lead electrocardiogram (ECG) results, relative to pre-treatment baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to follow-up, an expected average of 35 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with a change in ECG results indicative of an adverse event, relative to the pre-treatment baseline, is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of subjects with clinically significant changes in laboratory test parameters, relative to pre-treatment baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to follow-up, an expected average of 35 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with clinically significant changes in serum biochemistry, haematology and urinalysis, relative to the pre-treatment baseline, is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of subjects with a clinically significant change in vital signs, relative to pre-treatment baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to follow-up, an expected average of 35 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with a change in vital signs (systolic blood pressure, diastolic blood pressure, pulse rate) indicative of an adverse event, relative to the pre-treatment baseline, is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of subjects with a clinically significant change in body temperature, relative to pre-treatment baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to follow-up, an expected average of 35 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with a change in body temperature indicative of an adverse event, relative to the pre-treatment baseline, is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of subjects with a clinically significant change in body weight, relative to pre-treatment baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to follow-up, an expected average of 35 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with a change in body weight indicative of an adverse event, relative to the pre-treatment baseline, is presented.

clinical_study.condition: To Provide Further Information About the Potential Need for Sativex Dose Adjustments in Patient Populations.

arm_group.description: Four sprays of Sativex taken within two minutes of pH measurement immediately following oral pre-treatment with Coca-Cola (30 mL held in the mouth for 45-60 seconds then spat out, repeated three times).

Four sprays of Sativex taken within two minutes of pH measurement immediately following oral pre-treatment with tap water (30 mL held in the mouth for 45-60 seconds then spat out, repeated three times).

Four sprays of Sativex taken within two minutes of pH measurement immediately following oral pre-treatment with milk of magnesia (30 mL held in the mouth for 45-60 seconds then spat out, repeated three times).

intervention.description: Oromucosal spray containing THC (27 mg/mL) and CBD (25 mg/mL) in ethanol:propylene glycol (50:50) excipients, with peppermint oil (0.05%) flavouring. Each 100 μL spray delivers 2.7 mg THC and 2.5 mg CBD.

overall_official.affiliation: Quintiles Drug Research Unit at Guy's Hospital, Quintiles Ltd, 6 Newcomen Street, London SE1 1YR, United Kingdom
